definition: to walk right into the trap

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫发现自己被缠在一个逃脱不掉的罗网中。

sentences.english: An old fox is not easily snared.
The fear of man is a trap.
All previous "devil" can beat step, escape the net of police bs.
sentences.chinese: 历次“魔鬼”都能抢先一步，逃离警方布下的罗网。

sentences.english: He that gathereth treasures by a lying tongue, is vain and foolish, and shall stumble upon the snares of death.
sentences.chinese: 以谎言伪语骗得的财宝，是浮云轻烟，死亡的罗网。

sentences.english: She entrapped herself in the web of her own lies.
sentences.chinese: 她陷入了自己编造的谎话罗网。

sentences.english: Obstinate are the trammels, but my heart aches when I try to break them.
sentences.chinese: 罗网是坚韧的，若要撕裂它们，我又会心痛。

sentences.english: Or maybe longer than that if you can keep your web wound tight around him.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还不止，只要你的罗网把小主公套得更牢一点。

sentences.english: Obstinate are the trammels, but my heart aches when I try to break them.
sentences.chinese: 罗网是坚韧的，但是要撕破它的时候我又要心痛。

sentences.english: You can catch these insects by tempting them to fly into a trap.
sentences.chinese: 你可以引诱这些昆虫飞进罗网从而捉住它们。

sentences.english: He himself fell into snares spread for her.
sentences.chinese: 他自己陷入了原为她撒开的罗网。

sentences.english: To see the universe as it is, you must step beyond the net.
sentences.chinese: 要得见真如，你必须踏出这个罗网。

sentences.english: He became gradually enmeshed in the web of Her all-pervading presence.
sentences.chinese: 他逐渐地陷入她遍及所有的罗网中。

sentences.english: A very few do jump out of the net, making a big splash in the water.
sentences.chinese: 非常少数的会跳出罗网，发出很大的溅泼声。

sentences.english: The hunters used nets to entrap the lion.
sentences.chinese: 猎人们以罗网诱捕狮子。

sentences.english: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, to decline from the ruin of death.
sentences.chinese: 敬畏上主，是生命的泉源，使人脱免死亡的罗网。

definition: cage used to hold or transport prisoners
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
filling the entire sky/covering everything (of fog, crime, disaster etc)
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
